codeSystems.name: ImmunizationFunctionCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Function Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the function a practitioner or organization may play in the immunization event. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationFundingSource
codeSystems.title: Immunization Funding Source
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the source of the vaccine administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationOriginCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Origin Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person, entity or organization who administered the vaccine. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationProgramEligibility
codeSystems.title: Immunization Program Eligibility
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the patient's eligibility for a vaccination program. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose of vaccine was administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationRouteCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Route Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the administrative routes used during vaccination. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: CodesForImmunizationSiteOfAdministration
codeSystems.title: Codes for Immunization Site of Administration
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the body site where the vaccination occurred. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationStatusCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Status Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the current status of the administered dose of vaccine.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationStatusReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Status Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose of vaccine was not administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationSubpotentReason
codeSystems.title: Immunization Subpotent Reason
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationTargetDiseaseCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Target Disease Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the disease that the dose is being administered against. This value set is provided as a suggestive example and includes the SNOMED CT concepts from the 64572001 (Disease) hierarchy.

codeSystems.name: CommonLanguages
codeSystems.title: Common Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: USCoreClinicalNoteType
codeSystems.title: US Core Clinical Note Type
codeSystems.description: The US Core Clinical Note Type Value Set is a 'starter set' of types supported for fetching and storing clinical notes.
